basic.floral_language:
Echeveria setosa v. deminuta
Floriography: clever, lovely, warm
Is a small Echeveria with blue-green leaf color, like a blue coat, very vivid and lovely, leaves are in spoon shape with long hairs along edges, closely arranged in a rosette, like a blooming lotus, with abundant sunlight, leaf tips turn red. 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormancy in summer, need place under scattered light. Flowers sometimes, red color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color blue green, when sunny leaf tips turn to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, when in a short period of dormancy in summer, reduce water and shade properly
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 10-15 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered and dead leaves and excessive daughter plants
